pageContext.claim: “We have a very powerful wall. But no matter how powerful, you can cut through anything, in all fairness. But we have a lot of people watching. You know, cutting -- cutting is one thing, but it's easily fixed. One of the reasons we did it the way we did it -- it's very easily fixed to put the block back in. But we have a very powerful wall. But you can cut through any wall.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump used to say no one could cut through the border barrier he is erecting, or even climb over it: He called it “virtually impenetrable” and likened the structure to a “Rolls-Royce” that border crossers cannot get over, under or through. But then The Washington Post reported that the barrier was easily breached. "Smuggling gangs in Mexico have repeatedly sawed through new sections of President Trump’s border wall in recent months by using commercially available power tools, opening gaps large enough for people and drug loads to pass through," the newspaper reported. So Trump tried to falsely say this was by design, notwithstanding this is the opposite of what he had said before.
